bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical note
bioghist.p: James Bumgardner Murphy, 1884-1950, scientist in pathology and in charge of the laboratory of cancer research (1923-1950) at The Rockefeller Institute for Medical Research from 1910 until his death in 1950.
Member of numerous Societies, Boards and Clubs.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Papers are primarily administrative correspondence, 1910-1950 including handwritten letter applying, for fellowship at The Rockefeller Institute for Medical Research. A few biographical items, including early photographs, newspaper items, bibliography and Memorial Minute are included.
Administrative correspondence deals with budgetary matters, expansion of laboratory space, scientific assistants.

Includes 1933 exchange on extension of appointment of Albert Claude; 1934-1935 exchange regarding reappointment of Clara Lynch; 1927 Simon Flexner correspondence regarding appointment of Esther Boughton as technical assistant; and 1947-1949 correspondence and decisions, and budget material dealing with American Cancer Society grant based upon recommendation of Committee on Growth of the National Research Council.

1948 April 5 copy of letter from Herbert Gasser to John D. Rockefeller, Jr. explaining terms of grant from American Cancer Society for work in J.B. Murphy's laboratory providing that discontinuance would not embarrass the Institute.
